case_vignette:
A 32-year-old woman presents with an itchy rash that began 3 months ago. She has a history of anxiety but otherwise no known medical conditions. She has tried over-the-counter hydrocortisone cream to treat the rash, finding some relief from the itchiness, but the rash continues to spread. She has no known allergies and has not changed her skin care products or medications. On examination, the patient has dark purple and gray flat-topped papules with fine gray-white streaks on her flexural wrists, dorsal hands, elbows, ankles, and dorsal feet. The rash is most pronounced on her wrists and ankles. The patient is concerned about the possibility of a skin cancer diagnosis.

question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I have an itchy rash that began three months ago, and despite using over-the-counter cream, it continues to spread. The rash features dark purple and gray flat bumps with fine streaks, mainly on my wrists and ankles.
Have you experienced any similar skin issues in the past or do you have any chronic illnesses?
No, I have not had similar skin issues in the past, and my only known medical condition is anxiety.
Does anyone in your family have a history of skin diseases or autoimmune disorders?
I don't know of any family history of skin diseases or autoimmune disorders.
Do the rashes worsen with exposure to sunlight, heat, or after certain activities?
I have not noticed any changes in the rash with exposure to sunlight, heat, or after certain activities.
Have you noticed any changes in the texture of your nails, or experienced any hair loss recently?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in the texture of my nails or experienced any hair loss.
Final Diagnosis: Lichen Planus.
